item.title: On the pavements outside 47 American Dry Cleaning, 31st August
item.description:
There is a large square hole in the pavement outside 47 Hampstead High Street, American Dry Cleaners. Around 20cm wide. Today at 15:48 my wife's shoe and left foot fell into the hole, she thought she had broken her ankle and her big toe, luckily she has just swollen her ankle and badly bruised her toes, and a damaged shoe. We have taken many photos but your website would no accept them. I can email them to you. We informed the lady in the Dry Cleaners, she told us to inform the Council. We went to Boots and purchased various items including bandages and pain relief. My wife is still in pain and limping. Please can you fix this hole ASAP so it doesn't happen to someone else. Please can you also send money to cover items bought in Boots and for the pain and discomfort she is in. Regards David & Beverley Mckeon
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampstead High Street, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent litter trap, 31st August
item.description:
Ive raised this several times and even cleaned it up myself. There are two issues - why are there flimsy metal fences on the pavement? If the brick walls behind are at risk of falling, these femces aren't going to cut it. Second is the fact they been left there for months trapping tree debris and litter, for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Plumstead Common Road, Shooters Hill, London
